course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: You have an idea you have invested in. How should you treat it?
options: Define a kill criterion: we stop if [observable condition]; run the test; stop investing when it fails

questions.question: In this framework, how is "kill early" defined or applied?
options: Stopping bad or wrong ideas as soon as evidence shows they do not work
Cancelling all projects regardless of evidence
Firing people early in the project
Cutting budget only and not scope

questions.question: Why define a kill criterion before running the test?
options: So you know when to stop investing; otherwise sunk cost takes over

questions.question: Sunk cost (continuing because we already invested) leads to:
options: More waste; you keep investing in an idea that evidence says is wrong

questions.question: Treating killing an idea as personal failure can result in:
options: Keeping bad ideas alive and wasting resources

questions.question: When should you check the kill criterion?
options: At a set time or signal; decide when you will check before you start

questions.question: For one idea or project, what should you write down?
options: The kill criterion: we stop if [observable condition]; and when you will check it
